How do I apply to Wittenberg?
How do I make a gift to Wittenberg?
How do I schedule a campus visit?
Is Wittenberg the right fit for me?
This is the center of everything.

Whether it's embracing adventure through study abroad, serving beyond one's self, participating in athletics, conducting research with faculty, or landing the dream job, Wittenberg students find personal and professional success.

The brand-new fully renovated and expanded 265,000-square foot Health, Wellness & Athletics (HWA) Complex, and its impressive indoor practice facility, The Steemer, is redefining student success, community engagement, and NCAA Division III.
Martin Luther King Jr. Convocation Slated for Jan. 20

Freeman A. Hrabowski III, president, University of Maryland, Baltimore County, will present this year’s Martin Luther King Jr. Convocation at 11:15 a.m. Monday, Jan. 20, at Weaver Chapel as the 2019-2020 Wittenberg Series continues.
Kathleen A. Reinsel, associate professor of biology and the director of the marine science program at Wittenberg, has been named the George Greenawalt Professor in Biology.

The Southwestern Ohio Council for Higher Education (SOCHE) recently recognized six Wittenberg employees with Excellence Awards. Three staff members and three faculty members were each honored and will be promoted by SOCHE over the next few months through a series of special communications.

With more than 760 career coaching wins, Charlie Painter, Wittenberg University class of 1969 and recipient of the 2018 Dayton Agonis Club Don Donoher/Mike Kelly Coach of the Year award, was inducted this year into the Ohio Tennis Coaches Hall of Fame.
The Wittenberg Series - Martin Luther King Jr. Convocation

Our campus has been widely acclaimed for its beauty and award-winning architecture. We think you'll agree that it's one of a kind. During your visit, we want you to meet the amazing people that make Wittenberg the special place it is.

How do I apply to Wittenberg?
How do I make a gift to Wittenberg?
How do I schedule a campus visit?
Is Wittenberg the right fit for me?
Is Witt your fit? Schedule your visit today!

All students who submit an application for admission by January 15, 2020, will receive a $500 Tiger Up! Award per year upon acceptance to Wittenberg. This scholarship can be combined with other Wittenberg scholarships for which the student may qualify. To complete the application file, students must submit an official high school transcript.
This is the Center of Everything
Tour our historic and park-like campus. Perhaps you want to take part in a Chemistry lab or experience a game day? We have both individual and group visit options available!
Have questions about life at Witt?
We’re more than just a pretty campus with a Frisbee golf course.
Explore our student living, dining, safety, and wellness opportunities.
At Wittenberg, coursework is about more than hitting the books. It takes you out of the classroom and into the field, into the lab, and into the world.
The Next Best Thing to a Visit
Let us take you on a guided tour of 37 buildings on over 100 acres of rolling terrain. It's just big enough to be yourself and just small enough to not get lost on the way to class.

* We accept either the Wittenberg Application or the Common Application as a Priority Application.

All students who submit an application for admission by January 15, 2020 will receive a $500 Tiger Up! Award per year upon acceptance to Wittenberg.  This scholarship can be combined with other Wittenberg scholarships for which the student may qualify. To complete the application file, students must submit an official high school transcript.

"Wittenberg has always looked for students who want to make a difference. This is infused in our mission, and we believe these are the students who will enhance our community." – President Michael Frandsen, Ph.D.
Wittenberg provides a uniquely active and engaged learning environment that instills in its students the skills and confidence to make an impact on the world.
Wittenberg is One of America's top Green Colleges
